ab.title: Genesis 40
ab.l: And it was after these things, the cup-bearerof the king of Egypt and his baker sinned againsttheir lord the king of Egypt.
And Pharaohwas angry at his two officers, at the superior of the cup-bearers,and at the superior of the bakers.
And he put them under the guard of the house of the superiorof the executioners, into prison, the place where Josephwas imprisoned.
And the superiorof the executioners assigned Joseph with them, and he servedthem. And they were one year under guard.

Andthe two of them dreamed a dream, each his dream, in one night, each manaccording to the interpretation of his dream, the cup-bearer and the bakerof the king of Egypt, who were imprisonedin the prison.
And Joseph came in to them in the morning, and sawthem, and, lo, they turned pale.
And he askedPharaoh’s officers that were with him under guard in his lord’s house, saying,‘Why do your faces look so bad today?’
Andthey said to him, ‘We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it.’And Joseph said to them, ‘Lo, interpretations are in the hand of God.Now, tell me them.’
And the superiorcup-bearer told his dream to Joseph, andsaid to him, ‘In my dream, lo, a vine was before me,
And in the vine were three branches. As soon as it budded,its blossoms shot forth, and its bunches ripened into grapes.
And Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand. And I took thegrapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, andI gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.’
And Joseph said to him, ‘This is the interpretation of it: The threebranches are three days.
Yet within three daysPharaoh shall lift up your head, and restore you to your place,and you shall give Pharaoh’s cup to his hand, after the formermanner of life when you were his cup-bearer.
But only remember me with you when it shall be good for you, andpractice kindness with me, and make mention of me to Pharaoh,and bring me out of this house.
Because I was stolenaway out of the land of the Hebrews, and also here I have donenothing that they should put me into the prison.’
Andthe superior of the bakers saw that the interpretation was good, and hesaid to Joseph, ‘Me too. In my dream: and, lo, I had three whitebread baskets on my head.
And in thehighest basket were |some| of all of Pharaoh’s foods, the work ofbakers, but the birds ate them out of the basket on my head.’
And Joseph answered and said, ‘Thisis the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days.
Yet within three days Pharaoh shall lift your head up from you,and shall hang you on a tree. And the birds shall eatyour flesh from you.’

And it wason the third day, it was Pharaoh’s birthday, andhe made a feast for all his servants. And he lifted up the head of the superiorof the cup-bearers and of the superior bakeramong his servants.
And herestored the superior of the cup-bearers to his positionof cup-bearership, and he gave the cupin Pharaoh’s hand.
But he hanged the superior of thebakers, as Joseph had interpreted to them.
And the chief cupbearer did not rememberJoseph. And he forgot him.
